101564523.review:
I have to say this game was pretty fun to go through, especially as a person who really loves escape rooms. The puzzles and detail just fit so well together, and was super fun to play. The only 2 things I would've enjoyed is 
1: make the puzzles in the space themed rooms more clear, as some of them were a huge pain to go through (especially that molecule puzzle, the instructions were super unclear and was just tedious to go through)
2: why does this game only let people use a flimsy room creator to make rooms? why let the game limit itself? I have to say they really could've done better when making the workshop for this game as it looks pretty limited, if they just let people add whatever they want, then rooms from the workshop may be more spectacular than they are now. One example would be ktane (keep talking and nobody explodes), a game where you have to defuse a bomb by having someone else tell you instructions for solving various modules. It didn't do so well at first, with there being only 14 modules that were kinda boring as time went on, but once they opened up their workshop, that drove people to make some super cool modules! Some of these modules included ciphers, puzzles, missions, and stuff I didn't even know was possible when it came to the workshop! I just feel like if we could do the same for this game (aka make the room creator thing more open when it comes to creating stuff and allowing new mechanics like scripting), then perhaps this community will grow stronger and better!
Let me know what you guys think in the comments of this post, thank you.

Update :
Ok, so the additional 58 hours since the first review was mostly (80%-90%) consisted of me trying to play around with the editor and eventually created a level in the workshop which you can find here :
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2642605827
The editor is good enough to create a good level, as evident in a lot of great levels on the workshop made by the community. Though I miss some of important basic function that is suppose to be there, like audio cue, the ability to import new 3D objects (ok maybe this is not so basic) and easier way to put our own custom texture. I still think this game have a great value, with the developer keep releasing new rooms and the excellent rooms created by the community. I definitely recommend this game to escape room or puzzle enthusiasts in general .

An incredible time!

Played through the first 2 sets (10 levels) and a workshop level with a couple friends of mine and we had an absolute blast. It feels exactly like we were in a real life escape room playing with each other, passing clues and solving puzzles, switching tasks with someone else when we didn't understand what to do. Every puzzle had its "Aha!" moment and all of a sudden made perfect sense, nothing felt weird or like BS, everything was so satisfying to complete. And the hidden tokens always gave us something to do in the small moments where we were waiting for a teammate to finish something.

Took a peak at the level editor and it seems great! Lots of great logic options for really complex puzzles. Hugely looking forward to the things people will make. Also really excited for the new set of levels they're making! Hope we get a lot more objects in the level editor too for variation, would be great if we could import our own assets and models into it, hope we get that soon.

Even in its current state with limited workshop levels, its a great experience I would highly recommend to anyone. Looking very forward to the future of this game.

101320087.review:
Pros:
-The puzzles are engaging and rest firmly in the "satisfying" difficulty: not too hard and not too easy. 
-The music and level design are enjoyable to see and hear.
-The community puzzles offer endless playability.
-There's a bonus scavenger hunt element for hidden object fans.

Cons:
-Some of the mini game controls are atrocious. Mouse dragging constantly breaks (at least it does for me), causing what should take ten seconds to take two minutes or more.
-It's a very short game. Each room took between seven to ten minutes to complete, so you can finish all the rooms in a couple hours.
-While the community puzzles do extend the game time to essentially infinity, there is no quality control for them as there is for the main game. 

In summary, it's a very fun, if short, puzzle game. It's not terribly expensive, so I can recommend it wholeheartedly. If it ever drops to $10 or less, I'd call it a must buy.

101320016.review:
Very fun puzzle game! The only thing lacking is FORCED co-op, where teammates must work together in order to solve the puzzles, currently all puzzles can be done by 1 person. I look forward to see what community maps come from this!

101318648.review:
I'm a sucker for puzzle games and I'd play anything that gets me thinking about how to solve a certain problem or situation. Enjoyed many games out there, some of which get you bored quick, others are good time-wasters, and some select few get me hooked and range from great games to genius masterpieces like Valve's Portal games, The Room series, Safecracker, Myst, and a few others.

This game here, Escape Simulator, was on my wishlist. I don't even remember putting it on my wishlist or how/where I even saw it first.. (probably some steam "Coming Soon" thing.. I have no idea). Today I got an email mentioning that this game is out, and wanting another puzzle game, I just bought it.

[u]It immediately got me hooked pretty well.[/u]

The [b]game mechanics are very good[/b]: simple, smooth, and enjoyable.
The [b]puzzles are very well designed[/b], and do engage the brain quite well. They're not impossible to solve, yet not very easy to figure out.
The [b]graphics are simple and beautiful[/b]. Nothing too fancy, so it should run on most PCs, and they do look good.
The [b]music is awesome[/b] and very relaxing. It's as if it helps with boosting the brain's thinking and concentration level.

It's a new puzzle game I'll highly recommend to my friends in case they bump into it and see this review.

Just don't do what I did, buying the game at 12am. It's now 3am, and I just finished the Egypt puzzles and will proceed with the rest. I guess I'll be calling in sick to work tomorrow.

Cheers to the devs for such an awesome game!
